abstract: Two groups will file shareholder resolutions with the parent companies of the six major studios to demand stronger studio controls on youth-rated movies that depict smoking.
snippet: Two groups will file shareholder resolutions with the parent companies of the six major studios to demand stronger studio controls on youth-rated movies that depict smoking.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The major media companies are coming under renewed attack by a group of faith-based shareholders who say they want more progress in limiting the cigarette smoking that young people see in movies.

headline.main: Advocacy Groups Challenge Studios Over Smoking in Youth-Rated Movies

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
